title: Formula to Determine Mean
text: The formula for the mean of a hypergeometric distribution is $$\frac{nr}{r+b}$$ where $$n$$ $$=$$ the size of the chosen sample, $$r$$ $$=$$ the size of the group of interest (first group), and $$b$$ $$=$$ the size of the second group.
speech: The formula for the mean of a hypergeometric distribution is  fraction, n r, over, r plus b,   where  n   is equal to,  the size of the chosen sample,  r  , is equal to,  the size of the group of interest (first group), and  b  , is equal to  the size of the second group.
pacedSpeech: The formula for the mean of a hypergeometric distribution is   fraction, n r, over, r plus b,
the size of the chosen sample,   r
the size of the group of interest (first group), and   b
the size of the second group.

title: Determining the Size of the Chosen Sample
text: What is the size of the sample? In other words, how many statistics students will be sample?
speech: What is the size of the sample? In other words, how many statistics students will be sample?
pacedSpeech: What is the size of the sample? In other words, how many statistics students will be sample?

title: Determining the Size of the Group of Interest
text: What is the size of the group of interest? In other words, how many business majors are in the pool to decide the sample?
speech: What is the size of the group of interest? In other words, how many business majors are in the pool to decide the sample?
pacedSpeech: What is the size of the group of interest? In other words, how many business majors are in the pool to decide the sample?

title: Determining the Size of the Second Group
text: What is the size of the second group? In other words, how many non-business majors are in the pool to determine the sample?
speech: What is the size of the second group? In other words, how many non-business majors are in the pool to determine the sample?

title: Use the Formula
text: Using the formula, what is the expected value rounded to the hundredths place?
